Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler101365
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. We were traveling with children and they gave us a early check in AND our car stayed there the day we checked out (St. Patrick's Day of all days). Staff answered every question with a smile and were very friendly and helpful. Parking was FREE, and this was huge for us. The shuttle was fabulous. It always left on time and we had front door service to all museums, etc. We were dropped 30 feet from the Chicago River ON ST. PATRICK'S DAY to watch them dye the river. What service!! The two drivers we had were so friendly and pleasant. The only time we had a problem with the shuttle was when a staff (I think actually the owner or manager) gave the wrong pick up point to our driver. Every other day, all we had to do was call and they picked us up. Room was super clean and neighborhood was really cool. I was with my husband and two young children and we thought it was great. I would have liked it better if the rooms in the main hotel had heat/cool control. It was unusually warm for March and with the window open, the traffic was too loud. I also think adding a fridge and microwave would really make me want to stay again. Price was awesome for all the service we got.

Reviews.Title: “I never knew a lakeshore view is actually a highway”
Reviews.Author: Jake M
Reviews.Content: The staff are unhelpful and the view of the water has a highway infront of it. But the rooms were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel on Lake Shore drive in close proximity of Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Avadhutjoshi
Reviews.Content: Hello friends, I had read lot of negative reviews about this hotel but still dared to book a room for 5 nights as I had limited budget and wanted a hotel which would be closer to Convention Center. The Good: The hotel is right infront of Michigan lake and offers a very good view. The location is ideal for travelers as it offers free parking and easy to locate. They also have free shuttle to downtown at scheduled intervals and so connectivity is to downtown is good. The train station is also 5 blocks away and you can easily walk to 43rd street station from the hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. The lounge is not very attractive but overall facilities are good at the price they offer. The internet connectivity was good in rooms and it was free so I enjoyed it. The Bad: Far away from downtown and you are dependent on their shuttle to travel to the downtown. The breakfast had limited menu and I wish they had better varieties. The swimming pool was not operational & gym was too small. It is a good budget hotel with all basic amenities and good if you want a cheaper accommodation nearby Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “it was poor”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: I booked that hotel using price line . When i saw the hotel and its room i was shocked . rooms were tinny and old furniture. Pool was dirty and also in some out side location from hotel. after watching this i left the hotel and book another in down town chicago. And they did not refund me my money.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Harriet B
Reviews.Content: My heart sank when I saw this place in person. The lobby is nice enough, but we had to walk outside the lobby building, past a seedy rundown pool, to another building where our room was on the second floor. Did I mention that there is no elevator? I had a really heavy suitcase to haul up a steep flight of stairs alone. The room was cleaner than I expected, given the shabbiness of the rest of the place. The hallway smelled terrible, and that smell never went away. The beds were adequate. But really, I felt like I was spending a night at the Bates Motel. Unless you're ready for a walk on the seedy side, I'd give this place a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend more than $79 a night...”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: I only had a week to find a place and couldn't get anything downtown for 3 nights in my price range. Despite the other reviews I decided to take the chance-- besides I got a discount for 3 nights, about $79 a night. Upon reflection I probably overpaid. The hotel website does not advertise that it's only two blocks from the Hyde Park 51st/53rd St metra stop. Which considering how rundown the place is, you'd think they want to mention the convenience. When I got there my heart sank, it looks really bad from the outside. I checked in with no problems, but on the way to my room the hallway smelled awful. Like a mixture of standing water, mold, and funky feet. It turns your stomach at first but you get used to it. Surprise! My room wasn't that bad. It looked and smelled clean, I thought the carpet would be the same horror out in the hall. There were a few problems: coffee grounds were smeared on the table near the pot and some outlets didn't work. My neighbors looked a little shady, since I was alone I made sure I kept the door locked. But overall I was satisfied with the room. Biggest problem: unreliable wifi. I brought my laptop hoping to get some work done and on the second night it completely stopped working. The restaurant was okay. Stay away from the french fries, they're little grease traps.

Reviews.Title: “not up to par”
Reviews.Author: lorin g
Reviews.Content: Run down. We needed a pet friendly place. Did not want to pay big bucks. Room was clean but hallway smelled terrible. Whole place was run down. The lack of basic upkeep around the hotel made us second guess our room. It appeared clean but the staff obviously did not care about the appearence so how well would they clean the rooms? Surprised that a national chain would sink so low. If you are only staying the night and need to close your eyes and then leave, then this place works. Can not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Inn - Nice Plan to stay in reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Sayan06011982
Reviews.Content: I personally feel that Ramada Inn is one of the hotels with reasonable room traiffs offering standard quality of food, rooms, services. Especially, we enjoyed the quality and quantity of complimentary breakfast that is been offered. Room service was good

Reviews.Title: “The location of this hotel is the ONLY good thing about it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOSTfan420
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep this as short as possible cuz I have a big list of complaints! We stayed 1 night in a lake view,double bed,nonsmoking room,4th floor main lobby section which I decided to go with cuz I read all the reviews n decided it would be the best choice. The lake view was the only thing nice about the room. Smelled horrible! beds were comfy but blankets were not. Tv was old. Not a flat screen, pic fuzzy, and the remote would only change channel going down, not up. I can almost guarantee the smoke detector didn't work. Looked about 100 yrs old and about to fall of the ceiling. No a/c or heat! There were knobs on this panel thing nut nothing happened. No vents in the room either but it was cool enough outside it didn't really matter. Reviews are right about the thin walls. We didn't hear much until we went to bed..for a good hour ppl were stomping, talking loud, slamming doors! That sucked! The noise from lake shore dr out front is pretty noisy but u get used to it! I loved the view! I didn't watch any tv but stared out the window watching boats on the lake and ppl running etc. Other then the view, the free parking and the closeness of the museums we visited( MSI, Shedd, and Field) everything else pretty much sucked! The restaurant next door is HORRIBLE! Had to send a few things back n waitress kept getting our order wrong. We ordered pizza from gordino's which was sooooo good, only the service messed up and we waited over an hour cuz they put pick up instead of delivery. Well this isn't so short so I'll sum it up......choose this as a last resort..and if u have to choose this ramada stay only 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Thread-Bare and Time Worn”
Reviews.Author: Rocket58
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the most disappointing property I have stayed at in many years. Ramada should be ashamed to be associated with this hotel, which looked like it was last updated in the 1960's: peeling wallpaper, worn carpets, nicked and defaced bedroom and bathroom furnishings. More water came out the back of the showerhead than the front, and there was no room temperature control -- had to open and close the windows (onto a noisy side street) to control temperature. The only good things this place had going for it was its proximity (by default) to the University of Chicago and the endless supply of hot water to wash off the icky feeling I had from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Near University of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Renee R
Reviews.Content: I was taking a student to the University of Chicago and visiting a relative in Hyde Park in Chicago. It is difficult to find a clean hotel near the University of Chicago but this one is a reasonable alternative to staying downtown, a long way from the university. The hotel is also close to Midway Airport and the Museum of Science and Industry. The hotel was not fancy but it was clean, comfortable, and the staff was friendly. The cost was about $115 a night with tax, much less than the fancier hotels near the convention center or downtown. It also has free parking, which is important if you rent a car as we did. There is Internet in the room and a small fitness center. I never went to the restaurant or ordered room service so I can't report on these. For my needs, the biggest advantages were its location, the cost, and the free parking. Although the hotel wasn't fancy, I didn't find any problems or inconveniences that disturbed our stay. I can see that it might be different if someone needed to be in other parts of the city and/or take transportation to those locations.

Reviews.Title: “parts were ok:)”
Reviews.Author: clarkmom
Reviews.Content: You could tell that the room has recently been refurbished, but the location of my room was terrible!!!It was right beside a very HEAVY door that slammed everytime anyone went in and out.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: kingkullt
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business event, the hotel is a little afar from chicago center, a 20 dollar ride with a cab, but there is a shuttle provided free from the hotel. Nearby there are some restaurants. The rooms are large, with the basic two beds and bathroom, a little out of date and old, but very clean, confortable and the bathroom was reformed with nice instalations. The breakfast is payed apart, w/ many options in the menu and fair price, and the restaurant is 20 meters distant from the rooms. Staff is very helpful. I thought it was a good option and nice cost-benefit ratio, just the distance from downtown is the disadvantage of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's improved”
Reviews.Author: wguterbock
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times since my mother lives nearby and have experienced all of the things mentioned in other reviews: worn furniture and rugs, holes in blankets, surly staff, indifferent cleaning, stuff that didn't work, noisy neighbors in moments of passion. But on this last visit I have to say things have improved. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and looked like it had recently been renovated, the shower was great. It was very hot and muggy in Chicago and the air conditioner worked great. There were plenty of towels and the internet was fast. The building is still showing its age but they are making an effort. The lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. It is still a great price and it is still the only hotel close to the University of Chicago. Taxis at the door and close to mass transit--train and bus--to downtown or McCormick Place. It is certainly no luxury hotel but the rates are reasonable and it really isn't bad. I did not try the restaurant this time. The exercise room is rudimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are really quite fine”
Reviews.Author: LJ36
Reviews.Content: This is the closest hotel to University of Chicago--and the price was right--so despite the iffy reviews here, we took the chance and stayed. My son and I thought the room was fine! The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the air conditioning worked (and muffled road noise), the water pressure was good and the bathtub drained, and the wi-fi worked. Really that is all I'm looking for in a one-night hotel stay. Oh and the front desk people were friendly and efficient. On the downside, the hallways and exterior are a bit sketchy and I was worried as we walked to the room, but the room itself was just fine. I didn't have the sense that our room had been recently updated, so I would say it was probably an average room for the property. Breakfast was not included in our room rate. We had a truly awful breakfast that we ordered off the menu. Even my teenage son wouldn't eat more than a few bites. My suggestion would be to go elsewhere for food.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, clean and location is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TerTod
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our one night stay in Chicago. We went up to visit the Univ. of Chiago for my son. This hotel is the closest you can get for a great price. Yes, I've been to more updated and modern hotels, but it was fine for our one night stay. The staff was super helfpul and hightlighted directions on a map for us on where to go. When we needed a taxi it was right outside the door. We were told if there wasn't one they would call one for us. The hotel room was adequate for us. The beds were clean, the TV and complimentary coffee were great. The bathroom was perfectly clean. I noticed the ceilings had water damage, but it didn't bother me. My only complaint was the walls are very thin. We could hear our neighors across the hall all the time. They were a loud family and we knew when they were coming and going. It wasn't that great at 2am!!! Oh, and our phone during the night. By the time we woke up it stopped.

Reviews.Title: “This Ramada lowered the bar...”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: I already am not a big fan of the Ramada chain do to problems I've had with the corporate service side, but was sent to this hotel anyway. My expectations were lowered, but somehow this hotel was able to set a new low in my hotel experiences. Without going into long detail which would make this review go on for pages, a summary: * The hotel room we booked wasn't available. They moved me to another room (two beds instead of one) and instead of apologizing - I really didn't mind, but at least an acknowledgement would have been appreciated - they noted that "at least with this room I'd have wifi". Wait? So I'm supposed to thank you for not getting the room I ordered which then allows me to have an amenity your site claims (or at least misleadingly implies when it says "Free wireless internet") is available throughout your hotel? * On the second night I found a bug under my pillow the size of my thumb. It wriggled away pretty quickly after I saw it and I couldn't find it again. I was too tired and already undressed from being soaked in rain on the way home, so didn't ask for a room change (another reason to thank them for two beds?). * The morning after I found the crawler I woke with six small itchy bites over my body. I assume this was from different bugs since the crawler didn't look like the sort of bug that bit people - it just looked creepy. Sure, these bites may have come from somewhere else, but it's hard for me to believe they came from anywhere else than from that room. * I had troubles raising a taxi to come back to the hotel. While I understand that a hotel doesn't have any responsibilities in this realm, in other times I've called my hotel and they've helped me out with problems like this (or at least been sympathetic). I called these guys and got the response "yeah, we can't help you with that" and offered me the taxi phone number I'd been trying. If this were the only problem, I'd have brushed it off (Ramada isn't known to me for their customer service, so this was well within what I expected from them). While not really a problem, the hotel just looked old and sad inside. The hallways with their sagging ceiling and tired lights just felt way past need of a remodel or update. Frankly, I don't care about this if the rest was decent which, well, see above. Overall it made my already poor opinion of Ramada, which was basically "avoid them if there are nearby alternatives" move to simply "no, not again."

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a Ramada”
Reviews.Author: texasbarb
Reviews.Content: First let me say, the staff here was very accomodating and relatively easy to work with. Now....beware of the internet. It is NOT available in all the rooms. I was told I would have to come to the lobby to use my computer. I pointed out the description of the room I reserved...free internet WiFi in the room. There was a little back and forth and we finally got our room key. Once in our room I turned on the computer and there was WiFi so that was all good. However, our room was right across from the elevator and there for early and late usage was disturbing. Our room was outdated as mentioned in other reviews. The remote for the TV only worked part of the time...no I didn't report it. The sink bowl the bathroom was broken and the water in the tub/shower did not drain well. Yes, we reported that. We were told that maintenance would come at 7am to fix them. NO...I don't want maintenance to wake me up at 7am. The air conditioning was questionable....we couldn't warm the room and had to turn the fan off so we weren't too cold. This meant fiddling with it all the time. The buildings are in disrepair and the awning shown in the picture is no longer there. The lobby area looked like it had been renovated but that's all. The noise from other guest rooms carried through to our room...screaming babies and loud children sounded like they were in the room with us. This hotel is not convienent to any dining other than the resturant associated with the hotel. The food was mediocre to fair at best. Service was the same. We had an "issue" with a meal that was inedible and the waiter was non existant....never checked back with us and never even refilled the water glasses. As a result of my complaining we were not charged for the meal and offered a complementary breakfast buffet. There was a shuttle service to take guests to downtown and a few other places but it ran only a few times each day. Unless the shuttle time coincides with your plans, plan on having to use a cab all the time. For the money we spent on cabs we could have stayed in the Loop. Over all I would not stay here again and would not recommend it. Yes it was less than the hotels nearer to the Loop but certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went wrong, and they don't give any help”
Reviews.Author: carolmomof3
Reviews.Content: The maid took my pillowcase off my personal pillow; I never got it back, despite asking twice a day for three days. Finally they mailed it to us after we'd gotten home...except it wasn't mine. Apparently taking the pillowcases of guests is common there. Priceline said we'd get free parking, internet and breakfast; when I asked about the free breakfast, they said I hadn't paid enough for free breakfast. I insisted it was on the deal, and they said I'd have to prove it before they'd do anything...their words. That was when I discovered it wasn't printed on my confirmation sheet...buyer beware. My daughter left her glasses there, and even though we've asked them to look in a specific place in the room, they won't go look. After we got home, I called to follow up on my pillowcase (it was expensive) and my daughter's glasses, and was told they'd call me back. Several days later when I called again, one young man at the front desk explained he hoped they were too busy to call me back. "Too busy for good customer service?" I asked. After lots of indignant explaining about their work load, he triumphantly concluded, "We are human, after all!" If you have no problems, you'll be fine here, but don't expect good customer service if anything goes wrong. They're pleasant enough, but do little to nothing to solve problems. Given the time I've put into fruitless phone calls, the cost of replacing my missing pillowcase and my daughter's glasses, this hotel turned into an expensive place, and completely aggravating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CarolSpringfieldIL
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews about this hotel that I was a little afraid of what I would find. The staff were helpful and kind; the pool was beautiful (the kids swam in it); the room was a king suite and we had a sofa bed and rollaway for the boys. Housekeeping made up both beds for the boys. The restaurant was reasonable and the view of Lake Michigan fantastic. Don't be afraid of giving it a chance. It isn't a new hotel but we enjoyed our stay. The free parking and shuttle service is a big plus. Thanks Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Tear Down”
Reviews.Author: WarwickTraveler29
Reviews.Content: Ramada Inn - 4900 South Lake Shore Drive, Chicago This hotel is past due for a tear down and a rebuild. 1st room â€“ no air conditioning 2nd room â€“ no working toilet (water pressure in the automatic flush valve was insufficient to flush anything, not even a piece of toilet paper) Other defects â€“ broken TV on/off switch in room two, broken a/c control switches in room 2, cracked sink bowl in room 2, no cups in room 1, TV remote does not work in either room Common Area defects â€“ Hallways are hot â€“ not air conditioned, elevators are slow, call lights are not lighted, 2nd elevator from parking garage in disrepair, no security and direct access from street outside to hotel floorspace using elevator 2 - not secure, not enough parking available Cosmetic â€“ room dÃ©cor is combination 70s and 80s. It's not timeless and not good. The bathroom finish materials are plastic and cheap and look terrible. Pluses â€“ staff is working with a failing albatross, yet maintains a positive attitude toward guests â€“ for the most part, housekeeping is doing a herculean job to keep bedding and towels and rooms in clean condition â€“ for the most part. Negatives â€“ staff management protocol when the hotel is fully booked, and there are no other rooms available in the entire city of Chicago - is to re-sell my reserved room at 4 pm. I learned this while trying to check-in at 6:30 p.m. First time I've ever encountered a hotel that re-sells a credit card reserved room at 4 p.m. â€“ not at 6 p.m., but at 4 pm â€“ amazing poor customer relations on this key item. That's when they offered me the room without air-conditioning. I had no choice but to take it. Overall conclusion: Do whatever you can to stay elsewhere. This hotel is broken. However, if you are a sturdy traveler and/or desperate, if pressed for a room because there are no other vacancies within 30 miles, it is possible to sleep here and shower here â€“ there is minimal but sufficient comfort due to the efforts of the housekeeping staff. I found the cleanliness of my two rooms acceptable. The lack of a working toilet could be a problem, though. Overall, for those with families or less intrepid, this hotel is not recommended. Ramada should really just tear this one down and start over...or sell it to someone who will.

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: theconners
Reviews.Content: Let me just say this, I was very excited to stay at this hotel because of the location. When we got there we were shocked... The room was way out dated, i wouldn't say "dirty" but it didnt feel clean. There was a huge old rusty pipe that ran from the floor behind the toilet to the ceiling. At breakfast the next morning, a piece of ceiling fell onto a table where someone was eating. It wasn't a small piece of ceiling either... I definitely would not recommend travelling here...

Reviews.Title: “Not so quiet space...”
Reviews.Author: HisQueen94
Reviews.Content: Ramada Inn Lake Shore is a nice, clean place to stay if you are visiting the city and don't want to spend an arm and a leg for a room. I had no complaints about the actual hotel. It was a safe, clean, and comfortable room to lay your head at night. The outdoor pool was lovely. With that said, I must be honest and speak about the noise that I encountered. During the first night I noticed a lot of traffic noise coming from Lake Shore Dr. (my hotel room was on the pool side about three "rows" back). I could tolerate the traffic noise again if I had to, but at times, it could get loud. On the second night, there seemed to be a group of young adults staying within the same "area" (six rooms, one outside door) as I and they were up all night in and out of each other's rooms and out of the hotel. All of the doors going to the hall and the outside were very loud. If you didn't hold the door back, they would slam shut....this is what I heard all night until about 3am. I chose not to call the front desk. I felt that the young adults might have retaliated if they knew who had called on them, and I didn't want any trouble, they were obviously drinking and having a fun time hanging in and around the hotel. All of the rooms are clustered together in one small area with one door leading to the outside. I was in one "area" with one outside door and six other rooms. The door leading out to the hallway was very thin and didn't control any noise. I heard everyone that came and went. I will say that I am a light sleeper, so take my review as it is......just that, my experience. I would probably not stay at this hotel again for the noise. Like I said, I am a light sleeper, but I do need my sleep and the noise was a big problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CookieNewBremen_OH
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what people expect, but this hotel is in a great location and I can't say enough about the hotel staff. They were very friendly and accommodating. Yes, the rooms are a little outdated, but ours was clean. This is about the only place in Chicago to get free parking and it's very close to the front lobby and in a gated area. The pool could use some work, but we weren't there to sit by the pool much. The free shuttle gets you to popular locations downtown, which is a plus. I've stayed here before and certainly would again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyAdvisor44535
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicao to celebrate a cousins birthday and wished I had read the reviews before staying here. Rude hotel staff and "way" outdated hotel. BTW, why have a swimming pool if it's BROKE!!!! On the plus side, the jazz band on Friday was great.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Run-down”
Reviews.Author: cfgoodygoody
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about my experience here was that it was only for one night! The rooms are very outdated and need to be remodeled. The shower made a noise while turned on. The TV in our room kept losing signal. We had to sign a waiver at check-in saying that the hotel isn't responsible for things taken from the room, which was not a good way to start our stay there. I don't plan to ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fdoozy
Reviews.Content: I really have no idea what the other negative reviewers are talking about--it's almost as if we went to separate hotels, or maybe I was just fortunate enough to stay in a good room? The hotel was very nice, the rooms were spacious, the staff was friendly, everything worked perfectly, from the bathroom to the ac to the free Internet. They even had a free shuttle to downtown and uchicago, which was very convenient. Don't walk in expecting Four Seasons--this hotel is along the lines of a Holiday Inn, and for the price and location, can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place to Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: jgolubovic
Reviews.Content: Although the location is pretty good in relativity to staying close to Hyde Park and Lake Shore Drive, this hotel was probably the worst place I've stayed in, in quite a while, and that includes places where we have used communal bathrooms. The ceilings were completed rotted and worn from water damage, electrical wiring was hanging out of the walls and ceilings. The cleaning service even got too lazy to come by and clean our room, even though we were gone from 8am until 10pm. When we called for service for cleaning, we were told that the entire staff had already left to go home. None of the plugs in our room worked for charging our cell phone. Also, the parking garage is a safety hazard. The elevator in the garage is not guarded by any security and leads straight up into the hallways of the rooms - Aside from the comfortable beds and free parking, this place really isn't up to par with today's standards.

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BETTY1011
Reviews.Content: this place was sick! Puke out front of the door, rude staff, asked for non smoking room and got smoking! Room was so dirty i slept in my clothes. i would have rather saved the 100 bucks and slept on the sidewalk in Wrigleyville!!!!!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE EVER!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel Forgotten by Ramada”
Reviews.Author: EilselFL
Reviews.Content: First, I want to make sure I applaud the staff for trying as best they can to service the people that come to stay at this hotel. It is obvious that they are working at a hotel that does not get the support and care that would make it a nice place at which to stay. The desk staff was friendly and as helpful as they could be. Positives: close to the University of Chicago and Lakeshore Drive. Negatives: dirty carpeting in the hallways, absent vending machines, doors that do not auto-lock consistently, doors that do not program correctly (took 5 tries to finally get our room key to work), sheets that rumple easily, too soft mattresses, and VERY thin walls (you can hear people using their bathrooms, walking around and watching tv).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl37315
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a couple of days and had a great time. The hotel is very clean and the service can't be beat. Each staff member we talked to was friendly and helpful, they suggested places to eat and what to do & see while we were in town. My company is planning on having a meeting in Chicago, I am definately going to put in my 2 cents worth and tell them we should have it at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent service and Professional Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Sunlikeshine
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago with my 5 and 7 year old and stayed at Ramada, Lake shore. The location is great with free parking was a bonus. The staff is very professional and knowledgeable. The manager took a few minutes to find out was everything okey with our stay. In fact, She recommended a few places where my kid had a amazing time. I was hesitant to book this hotel after reading some of the bad reviews. I did not find any of those bad things during my four days stay. Would come back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Scary looking outside but renovated inside”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed at this hotel is because the hotel was three blocks near a church we needed to attend for a funeral. On the outside, it looks like a dump. The folks hanging around the lobby at check-in looked questionable, but we were only there for eight hours to sleep and then check out. The bathroom fixtures and shower curtain were new, the bed was comfortable, the sheets were clean and the carpet was acceptable. The entrance to the room (carpeted) smelled of urine. All in all, this is not a great place to stay, but it's a good place to sleep and move on. We never ate at the restaurant. We paid a $119 a night (AAA rate) during St. Patty's day weekend. Parking was directly in front of our room. I would have never stayed here if my husband were not with me. A paint job on the outside would help the place out a lot. This hotel is not walkable to Michigan Avenue but there is a shuttle service to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “April is awesome at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: runnergirlbrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Ramada on Lake Shore Drive several times, including coming to celebrate as newlyweds! Each time we come or call April is always wearing a warm smile or you can hear the friendly greeting in her voice on the phone. She knows and loves her job as is evidenced by her knowledge of the area and local attractions. We will continue to visit because of employees like her!

Reviews.Title: “WOW- Amazing flexibility”
Reviews.Author: drlove37
Reviews.Content: We were 4- men and 2 teenagers. We had a conference to attend- so we took our boys and made it a sports trip with it ! Pre-season NFL and a mandatory visit to Wrigley's... So, I booked the trip with Orbitz- we drive from Canada to Buffalo and we fly to Chicago- obnly to realize that the Ramada Inn we are booked is way out of town- tOrbitz made a mistake. So after 2 hours on the phone with Orbitz, I don't get too far,,,, I called the Ramada myself- directly. WOW Ujwala and Angie!!!- The best They went the distance to make sure our visit was going to be a good one. We explained what took place and they even extended the courtesy of giving us gov. rate! The hotel is clean, quiet and at a great location. The outdoor pool was clean and the restaurant was very good. The shuttle makes it easy to get downtown! This will be my hotel when I go back to Chicago !!!

Reviews.Title: “Run down, bad location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: ANCY65441
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 15 miles from downtown, so you will have to catch a bus or cab to the magnificent mile, by the time you spend that you might as well stay at a nicer hotel downtown, def. not worth the savings since this is far away from everything and the place is dirty and run down, do not stay here, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Car broken into while in hotel parking ramp!”
Reviews.Author: PJA2009
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel around 8 am and could not check in early so I was told that I could park in the ramp attached to the hotel. I had all of our luggage and both of our backpacks in the back of my SUV (not visible from the outside). I took the shuttle downtown and when I got back a couple of hours later I discovered that my boyfriend's and mine backpacks were stolen from my car (both of our laptops were in the backpacks!). When I reported it to the front desk, they made a 'report' but never notified management. When I asked to speak to a mgr. about a related issued, she asked me "what happened? She had NO idea that a theft had occurred on her property, nobody notified her. All they said was 'i'm sorry this happened' and 'this has never happened before'. They didn't offer to comp part or all of our room. I was very disappointed with how this was handled! Would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: JoyLynn1
Reviews.Content: Shabby hotel (dirty walls, worn carpet, odd smell in the halls, ripped leather couch in the lobby). Poor customer service. Ordered room service at 2 pm. When I left the next morning at 7 am the tray was still in the hall. Walls are paper thin so I could hear my neighbors even though they were talking at a normal volume which made for an unrestful night. Not worth $119/night. Room was too hot (in November!) and no a/c so I had to open the window to cool off the room.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Nasty and rundown”
Reviews.Author: Davidl1957
Reviews.Content: Wallpaper pealing off, holes in the ceiling, filthy. The rooms were so hot that the only way to sleep was to leave the windows open in November! Room only had a heater but no cooling system. Other than one young man at the front desk, the staff was unfriendly and look to be bothered by having to help guests check in. The restaurant staff was equally aloof and lazy. This is a problem with management of the hotel and obviously not having any policy about being cheerful and polite to guests. The hotel is in bad shape and obviously has no maintenance program. The location is terrible and the neighborhood is unsafe. Internet only works in a few areas of the property. Don't ever stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Porkie4u
Reviews.Content: When I entered the room, it appeared to be in decent condition. However, I soon discovered that the heat/ac controls were broken. I was unable to control the temperature and the room was uncomfortably warm. I also soon realized that the walls were extremely thin. I could hear EVERYTHING that was going on in the next room. This caused me to have much restless sleep. Then on the 2nd morning of my stay, the TV broke. I was so disappointed with the hotel that I didn't even bother staying for the whole duration of my reservation and booked a different hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, appropriate for star rating”
Reviews.Author: Mike-TTUHSC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is low priced (I bid $58/nite on priceline and got it). It is about what you would expect from a two star. It is the only hotel in the area so if location is important, you should stay here. Free parking is great and was readily availabe and very convenient to rooms. It's an easy walk to the lakefront from the hotel lobby. The internet worked fine for me from my room. I received a room on the second floor which was direcly across from the elevator, and even though it was a weekend the noise was only a minor nuisance. The pillows are very cheap and very thick. I asked if they had a different type and they said no. This gave me a sore neck and I would recommend bringing your own pillow if you are sensitive to those things. I did not eat at the hotel, I ate at an outstanding restaurant in a strip mall very close by in HP called Cedars, it had middle eastern food and was very low priced and overall excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Still too expensive- Trotz allem noch zu teuer!”
Reviews.Author: Ringer62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here, because it was not as expensive as other motels and with being located at Lakshore Drivehought it's good to reach the city easily. And indeed, with a car you can just drive up the Lakeshore Drive and reach downtown, but without a car it's quite complicated and the red line subway is not running very often down here. Well the Hotel is ok. But i stayed in a smoking room, which is beside the main building and there is no WIFI working, so you must go and sit with your laptop in the lobby to go online! And there is always one frontdoor for reaching 4 different motelrooms, and damned the frontdoor slams like hell. No chance to sleep long, because as soon as the first ones are using the door , you are awake! And if your neighbours are a bit louder, you will definitely hear them! So, the hotel is clean, the staff is really friendly and helped me several times, but for the less sleep I got the and the inconvenient internet connection I must confess, it should be a bit cheaper, but on the other hand, it's Chicago, and there is nothing really cheap.
