Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mabelsmom77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is completely run down once you leave the front lobby. The rooms and hallways smell and everything is dated. We asked for a lake side room and when we opened the drapes everything outside looked like it was in a fog because the windows were so filthy. The front entrance is over run by these huge spiders and webs. Hallway carpets were't vaccumed. Ice machine on our floor didn't work, you stood in water up to your ankles when you showered, Ordered a rollaway for one night, Circa 1960, very uncomfortable, sagged horribly. Printer in guest services didn't have enough memory to print out tickets from their computer after tickets were paid for so we had to deal with that at the amusement park. Then to top it off, I told the maid that we didn't need maid service that day. I left the room for 1 hr and came back. Guess what? All the sheets were gone and so was my daughter's I Pod that was on the bed. I went to the front desk and asked for housekeeping. The manager came and said that it was probably picked up with the sheets,and they probably wouldn't get to it till much later because they were busy. ( Must be because of those 5000 rooms that I've read about!) Next day I talked to the General Manager because no one had found it. He talked to the head to housekeeping and the maid and the maid said she didn't understand what I had said to her and that is why she came back. Then the General Manger told me again that they didn't have the I Pod and basicly I was responsible for the loss because I didn't put out the " Do Not Disturb" sign out after talking to the maid. My family had left for the amusement park and no one had a key for that room EXCEPT myself and hotel staff. And I didn't take the Ipod. So be forewarned if you do not have your "Do Not Disturb" sign out when you leave the room, It's YOUR fault if you come back and anything is missing.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: cakebakerrach
Reviews.Content: We got a late start for our vacation and arrived at the hotel at 11:30pm, I requested a non smoking room through 1-877-CHICAGO. We got a "non-smoking room" according to the plate on the door, so why were there 3 ashtrays in the room. The manager told me that sometimes they "switch" rooms from non smoking to smoking. REALLY??? The second night after doing our sightseeing at 11:00pm we got back to the hotel, we ran our key and nothing, go to the front desk get new keys-swipe them and nothing, go back and get a second set of new keys- swipe and got nothing. Security came and had to pry the cover off the lock and let us in. In his words "I will have my maintenence man get the batteries changed in the lock." Our second day, we return and againg swipe the key and nothing where the heck is the new batteries?? Not that we wanted to spend time in our room that smelled like a pack of marlboros, and the furniture looked like it was bought at the resale shop. We never got clean towels or had our beds made, the swimming pool while the water looked nice the 20 or more layers of paint that were chipping off was pretty gross. My daughter asked if the water was going to drain down the hole in the floor. Overall the only thing that was nice about the hotel was the fact we could get right on Lakeshore Drive and head into Chicago. I will make sure I tell everyone I know to sleep in their car before they stay in this Ramada Inn Lakeshore. I felt like my issues were valid yet the front desk told me there was nothing they could do, I would have to talk to the manager who of course was off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel but surly staff”
Reviews.Author: kz518
Reviews.Content: Short version: This hotel was fine. If you're on a budget and willing to take a bus or drive to downtown Chicago, this hotel is perfectly adequate for the money. And it has a pool. But the staff was pretty unpleasant. Look. I know that it was the weekend of Lollapalooza and the hotel was full. Still, my party and I went out of our way to be nice and smile to the hotel staff who were not outright hostile but they were terse and unfriendly for our entire stay. The value was pretty reasonable. The hotel is nothing fancy but there is a pool and a small workout room. Everything was clean enough. I did however reserve a room with two twin beds and got a room with one king so we had to pay extra to have a cot wheeled in (and we didn't have it for our first night so my poor sister had to sleep on the floor). Similarly, our room had maybe only one or two towels which were not adequate for three people. We arrived at the hotel at about 1 p.m. on Friday and asked if we could check in early. They told us we couldn't check in until 3 p.m. which we understood but the way they said it was a little harsh. They did let us leave our bags with them so we could go to the concert. We also asked for a room with two twin beds (like we reserved) and they said no and we asked for a cot and were told no. I understand - it was busy - but that was it. No offer of extra pillows or blankets, just no. The location is okay for the price. It seemed like a cute neighborhood. There's a bus that stops nearby as well as a subway stop though I think the subway stop may be in a rough area. There's a museum and cafe not too far away as well as an Original Pancake House. The bus was about 30 minutes from Grant Park and downtown Chicago. There's also a shuttle but we didn't want to ask the staff for more info about it since they were already pretty unfriendly. Also, when we were getting ready Sunday morning, a housekeeper knocked on the door at about 9:30 a.m. and asked if she could come in. We asked her to come back later. She knocked on our door again about an hour later. Now, sure, most people probably would have left by then, but this was Sunday morning. I'm confident that many of the guests in the hotel had probably checked out. Why did she keep bothering us? The actual room was fine. With the cot, it was a little tight for three people. The complimentary shampoo and conditioner were gross though. They made my hair feel terrible. I'm usually not at all picky about that type of thing but these were bad. In general, this experience could have been pretty solid if the staff had not been unpleasant for the whole weekend. I've stayed in cheap hotels before and been treated well. This was not that type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising value for modest cost”
Reviews.Author: Cloudtraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for its convience to Hyde Park area. Spent three days, two nights in this more than adequate hotel. Staff was pleasant, courteous, and helpful. Beds great. Slept like a log after sightseeing all day. Internet worked perfectly and continuously. We were surprised to discover that room cost included on-site parking, which in this urban neighborhood is at a premium. Room was clean and had been refurbished within the last couple of years. Our room on the north side had beautiful view of the lake from the big window, but was not noisey as it might have been overlooking Lake Shore Drive. Public areas were being reorganized and exercise machines were all over the lobby. Good restraurant on-site. Wide variety of ethnic eating options available in the Hyde Park neighborhood. Seemed to have been a flood on the 2nd floor and that area was being cleaned. Felt safe and secure. Not perfect, but certainly not the hotel others have complained about in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Motowngirl57
Reviews.Content: After the reviews I read about the Ramada Inn, I was afraid to stay there, but I had l already paid my money and it was within my budget. I was pleasantly surprised at the superb customer service(especially Angie) and the new manager(unfortunately I cannot remember her name). True enough the hotel needs some work, but our room was clean and the staff was incredibly nice and accommodating. The only drawback is the Lakeshore Cafe is horribly over priced and the food is lousy. There are not any nice, moderately priced restaurants near the hotel. Everyone has a negative experience somewhere no matter how exclusive the hotel is, but when you have a positive one, how about writing about that and giving credit where it is due!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Very poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: yeshko
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Chicago and stayed in Ramada Lake Shore for 3 days. I will just write the facts: 1) The first night we woke up at 4:00am with fire alarm and rushed down to the Lobby and waited there for 1 hour until the firefighters cleared the cause. It was not fire, but some broken pipes. 2) The next night the toilet got clogged and we had to switch rooms. 3) Our new room had no wireless internet connection and we had to go down to the lobby to check emails and so. 4) The hallways looked like they were not vacuumed for a week. 5) As someone else has already pointed out, the hotel STUNK. And it is really very strange that the management response to this is that "No, it does not stink". I found it quite funny:) 6) The hotel is in a very good neighborhood and I enjoyed walking through the Hyde Park to go to the beach. However, I do not think that I will stay there again....I hope, some one takes these reviews serious and do something about this hotel with great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: stephie55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 nights at the Ramada. We were on the budget so the free parking was a necessity. Parking was free to an extent. What we didn't pay for parking at the hotel we made up for in bus passes and taxi rides back at night. Yes, there is a free shuttle, but the last pick up for the night is 6:30pm. We were there to explore Chicago day and night. Yes, there is a bus that will drop you off 4 blocks from the hotel. The problem is the neighborhood was not a place to walk from late at night. Our part of the hotel had a broken security door. There was a make shift stopper made from packing tape and a room key. The light above our room door was not working and the other light flickered. Our shower had low water pressure and the ankle deep water left in the tub took a long time to drain. The light over our sink was tricky to turn on. You had to turn it on for a couple minutes and the gently wiggle it to get it to turn on. We nick named the place the Munster Estate. The pictures you see online ARE NOT what this place really looks like. The color and the shape you see online are the only things true about the pictures. The building itself has big time peeling paint and lots of spiders hanging from webs under all the lights near the entrance doors. The only good thing about this place is the Lakeshore Cafe next to the hotel. The service and the food were great.

Reviews.Title: “A litte known gem”
Reviews.Author: gillykvac
Reviews.Content: My husband I have stayed at the hotel once but went back a second time for a meal. The Hotel is a little old but kept very clean. the service was very good and very polite. The restaurant had a Friday night seafood buffett that was the best we had ever seen. We stayed there and attended a White Sox game in the evening, talk about and easy way to get to the game and back to the hotel, cap service was prompt. All in all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “RUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahj4077
Reviews.Content: There was a man directly above us hitting his child and she was screaming her head off. We could everything clear as a bell through the vents. I called down to the front desk 3 times and still nothing (even thought she kept promising security was on their way up). Finally I went down with my phone in my hand and threatened to call the police if security did not go up-the security guard knew nothing about it. There is internet-but only in non-smoking rooms. Hotel stunk. Like chlorine and garbage, In the room, hallways and lobby. Neighborhood is awful and you have to drive to the beach. Workers were just shy of rude-not helpful or friendly at all, and they moved incredibly slooooow. Plus its pretty shabby looking. Just not worth it at all.

Reviews.Title: “great front desk clerk terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: toots3633
Reviews.Content: First of all i would like to thank the front desk clerk angie for all your help, if that hotel had more employees like you then our stay would have been alot better. it took after our 3rd room to finally get cold air in our room. the engineer/maintenance guy was very ignorant to me and my wife and didnt want to have to do a little work to fix the a/c problems that we had in 2 rooms. so finally after moving 3 different times we actually got a room with cold a/c. so all in all the experience was terrible to say the least but again angie the front desk clerk is a employee any business would be a benefit to have on there staff. Thanks again angie you wasnt over looked by us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks in advance”
Reviews.Author: cpermanent
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Angie and Earl Adams for accommodating my request. I'm looking forward to my first Chicago trip and Ramada Inn stay. will send another review after my vacation Sincererly, Ellyn

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Angie!”
Reviews.Author: Manhattantraveler1
Reviews.Content: Angie in reservations was so so so helpful. There was a mix-up with my online reservation for the U of Chicago grad weekend. Angie was sympathetic and really helpful over a series of weeks and made it happen that I got my 2 night reservation for this coming June.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jessica1956
Reviews.Content: At first wasn't sure about this location, I wanted to be close to downtown, at check this nice clerk was telling me about a free shuttle that they offer to downtown and best of all free parking the rooms need a little work but the bed was comfortable and very clean i will be back on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but poorly maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiranananth
Reviews.Content: I booked in this Ramada hotel considering Ramada brand, but was disheartened as I was entering my room :( The location is extremely good, many of the rooms face the Michigan lake. View from the room in the morning is breathtaking. Rooms are poorly maintained, upholstery needs a complete overhaul and the corridors look dingy & dark

Reviews.Title: “tolerable”
Reviews.Author: vamos10
Reviews.Content: Pros: - close to University of Chicago with shuttle service to/from campus 3x/day - free gated parking - friendly, helpful staff Cons: - shower drain was backed up, so I showered in regurgitated bathtub water - thermostat dial broken and permanently set on hot, so I slept with the windows open in January in Chicago - TV did not work (remote or television itself)

Reviews.Title: “We were very comfortable for a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: brueg
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we visit Chicago. It is close to everything we want to see in the city, but the price feels more like what we would pay to stay in a far-away suburb. Parking at the hotel is free, and that cuts the price even more. We have never had a negative experience at the Ramada Inn Lakeshore Drive, and we don't even bother shopping around anymore.

Reviews.Title: “The reason we stayed another night!!!”
Reviews.Author: GreatTASTE_09
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the other reviews. This was a great hotel and the staff was amazing and friendly. They were so nice and hospitable that we stayed an extra night!! The room was huge and very well kept. The bar/restaurant had an amazing variety of well prepared food!! Again, do not believe the bad reviews. Go there and see for yourself. You will not regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: travtann
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the location is great. The room itself was terrible. The first room we were put in smelled like something had died in it. The A/C did not work. The "fridge" did not work either. We were moved to another room down the hall. It did not smell. The A/C did not work in this room either. The "fridge" kept our food cold when the housekeeper didn't shut it off. The hotels brochure state that they have Pillow tip mattresses. They did not in the 2 rooms we were in. It was the HARDEST bed that I have ever tried to sleep on. The guest rooms were in dire need of a good remodel. The bath room had been updated.

Reviews.Title: “The staff here made our first totally "tourist" visit to Chicago very pleasant."”
Reviews.Author: streetmedic
Reviews.Content: We have both been to Chicago several times on business, but never had a chance to really see the city. The staff at the Ramada Inn Lake Shore made the trip easy and pleasant. They were very helpful and answered all of our questions. The hotel itself is clean and neat, with a very nice restaurant and lounge just across the parking lot. The Friday night seafood buffet with a live jazz band was great.

Reviews.Title: “My Daughter's Wedding was a great success here with only 4 weeks to plan.”
Reviews.Author: worldtripper56
Reviews.Content: After having to change the location of our Daughter's Wedding Reception four weeks before the wedding with the help of Earl Adams, Director of Sales, he and the staff of Ramada made my Daughter and now Son in Law's wedding a beautiful event. From the Food to the finest details..thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes it's the housekeepers fault.”
Reviews.Author: Pattat11
Reviews.Content: I've seen the reviews. I can no longer speak about the main building only because they no longer allow smoking in that part of the hotel and we are now put in the rooms on the side. (my husband is a smoker) THey have redone their lobby and it looks nice. They've added an office space for internet usage and a very nice exercise facility. Of course they are trying to update but I'm sure it's expensive to take care of all that needs to be done so I can appreciate the small steps here and there. In this case though, the housekeeping staff are the guilty ones for not reporting room issues. It may be an older room and all but there is no reason for the shower curtain rod to be loose from the wall. Housekeeping should report this so it can be repaired before the next guest checks in. THe coffee pot, my bad since I didn't realize it should have a lid. I told my husband it was clogged and he went to pull out the filter part to unclog and all the hot water burned his fingers... I guess we needed the pot lid to hold a lever in order for the coffee to automatically drip out. Afterward we made coffee again and held the part with a pen so it would drip out. Housekeepings fault again because they are to check that everything in the room is working and there. The coffee maker outlet was not working. I tried the reset button and no luck so we had to move rthe maker to another outlet to get it to work. But to their defense on this, if no one has told the hotel the outlet is not working then they can't fix it so now that I've told them, hopefully they will look into that for the next guest.. Yes, I reported the shower curtain rod right away only because I did not want to be blamed for it being broken. I did leave a comment card in regards to everything else. My fellow roomates on the other side of the hall were a bit noisy if you know what I mean but once we were in the room and turned on the TV, we did not hear them after that except the doors shutting kind of hard from time to time. All in all, yes, I'll stay here again. I think the cost is high for the room but as far as the rooms compared to other hotels in the area, this is one of the lowest. THey always seem to be busy which is a good sign as well. THe night of my stay, the frontdesk recommended a pizza place and this was the best pizza and philly steak I've ever had. THe name had Cafe in it so if you stay here, definatly ask about this place. I've learned from tripadvisor that every guest looks at things diferrently and you have to just take the good with the bad and hope for the best. Could this place be better, yes it could but if it was toatlly 100% percent perfect in every way, you'd be paying much more.

Reviews.Title: “You can't get there from here”
Reviews.Author: deannsegal
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel since we were driving and it offered free parking in a downtown location. This hotel is not downtown! It doesn't look far on a map, but to get anywhere you have to drive, take a shuttle or a series of buses and trains. It is located on Lakeshore drive, but without good directions it is almost impossible to get to the little side street to the entrance. The desk staff was very friendly and the shuttle driver was great. I took the shuttle twice, to the Field Museum and the Art Institute. It's about 2 blocks to a bus stop, not bad, but id you turn the wrong way, you can end up in a very sketchy neighborhood very quickly. About the room- when we checked in, I found someone's dirty underclothes hanging in the bathroom and used soap in the tub, and a lot of mold. Yuck! After calling the desk, they still had not come to pick them up by the next morning, so I put them out in the hall. When my teen aged son woke up the next day, he found a camisole and thong made up in the bed. He thought it was funny, but I was a little grossed out. The security door was broken and slammed repeatedly as people entered and exited. We had a lovely view of the parking lot. They advertise free wifi, but it is only available in the lobby. This hotel needs a refurbish. It's old and it shows. I've stayed in worse, but next time I will spend a little more for a better location

Reviews.Title: “How Pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: malycat
Reviews.Content: Doing business in Chicago I always select this hotel as it is close enough to drive downtown in a few minutes and far enough to be out of the crazy congestion of downtown. What I love about this hotel is the friendly staff and terrific restaurant. Great food and prices and I just walk there. They have free parking, try that downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to UChicago, but don't count on internet access”
Reviews.Author: Shamare252
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to have done some updating, and it is better than the past. Problem is, they advertise free wireless, but if you are NOT in the main part of the hotel, you can access the wireless,. so it makes it hard for a business traveler to get things done, unless they want to sit in the lobby. That is just annoying. Itis easily accessible to the University of Chicago, but next time, I will probably stay out by Midway Airport so I can access the internet from my room. The Fitness Center is minimal, as is the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you only need a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jalan2er
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights when I visited the University of Chicago. This hotel seems to be the only hotel near the University. Not being familiar with the area, this hotel was the only choice I had. The hotel is actually NOT close to the University. However, the hotel had shuttles which take you to the University. I used the shuttle service only once when the driver was in the lobby when I was waiting at the front desk to ask the direction to the bus stop. However, if she hadn't been there and called me, I wouldn't have known that there was such services. Neither the receptionist nor the pamphlet in the room did not tell me about this. Also not told was the fact that the ROOM DIDN'T INCLUDE BREAKFAST. The receptionist told where the cafe was, so I simply assumed that I could have complimentary breakfast there. As a result, I had to spend about $10 more than I had planned. But for the receptionist's poor communication at the time of check-in, my stay was confortable overall. You can have a good stay, but no hospitality and no breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE... if I could have slept”
Reviews.Author: cman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Lakeshore for 6 exhausting nights in early April. My sister lives in Hyde Park and this hotel is the only game in town in that part of Chicago, but honestly I would rather sleep in a 7-11 parking lot than stay there again. We had stayed there before and it was never that satisfactory, but this time was by far the worst. There are a few positives... it is convenient to the UofC, and It's fairly easy to get downtown by car or the train. The staff was for the most part very kind and accomodating, and the beds were actually not horribly uncomfortable. The shower was fine and the suite we had was quite large. But that's where the positives end. The rooms themselves are tattered and smelly. Ceiling tiles are falling, paint is chipped, mirrors are cracked, and towels are rough. There was wireless internet, but it was very slow and spotty. Totally undependable. But all of that would be almost acceptable at the low rates the Ramada charges, if not for the NOISE. Yes NOISE, which drove me to the point of insanity. The walls are paper thin and one can hear EVERYTHING. Not only in the rooms next door, but also in the rooms above and below. Every scream, yell, moan and groan, belch and scratch. EVERYTHING. And all of this, dare I say, at 1, 2, 3 and 4 AM. Night after night. In room after room. Yes, we slept in FOUR rooms during our six night stay, changing rooms in the middle of the night. And in each one we were treated to a show of loud parties, yelling, fighting, screaming and endless F-U's. Over and over and over. I am not a particularly light sleeper, but this was too much. Each time we called the front desk, security tried to stop the noise, but to little avail. Once when security knocked on the door of a room below, we could hear a loud [--] YOU!" in reply. Nice. After 6 nights at the Ramada, we vowed never to return. Even if the room as free. Nice people. And cheap. But a horrible place. Don't waste your time there.

Reviews.Title: “Dogs are allowed.....but so are prostitutes!”
Reviews.Author: dlr5628
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the International Kennel Club Dog Show. The hotel is less than 5 minutes from McCormick Place and that is its best feature. The lobby was nice and the staff was friendly, but the hallways had a lot of wear and tear, the elevator broke down on Sunday and the room had a funny smell. There was no clock radio, presumably because it had been stolen! TV and refrigerator were quite dated, but worked. On Sunday at about 7:30 a.m., we encountered two prostitutes on their way home from a night of "in house." Yes, that's what they told us! They had been doing business out of a room on our floor! Fortunately, it was not noisy.....but yikes!

Reviews.Title: “*****WARNING******”
Reviews.Author: DPower2008
Reviews.Content: This building was the first stop on a two week road trip. We expected 'hotel' to be average clean and nothing too special. However we got a poor reception, and shocking rooms. We had rooms with electrical and plumbing hazards. The rooms were 1970s. The beds were comfortable, thats about it. Theres no pubs or restaurants near the place. Only stay here if its the only room left in Chicago. The owners need to spend a lot of money on it! the place gave us the shivers.........

Reviews.Title: “Staff was super!”
Reviews.Author: DeeHrdlicka
Reviews.Content: The staff was superb. My friend and I had such a good time because management took care of everything. Angela at the front desk was so helpful.The shuttle driver also was very personable and knowledgeable. Good people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Substandard”
Reviews.Author: senaer49
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel online, based on the Hyde Park location. It is in a neighborhood of beautiful high rise buildings next to the Lake. However, the facility is in terrible condition, the paint is peeling, the carpet is dirty and smells, it has outdated decoration and stained/peeling wallpaper. After one night we checked out and moved to the Chicago South Loop hotel. What a relief to be out of there! I cannot believe that a respected, well known hotel chain like Ramada would permit a hotel to be operated in that condition. We saw a piece of wallpaper peeled back next to an elevator and there was a hole all the way through! Security? At night they station two armed guards in the lobby! Do yourself a favor and pass on this place...

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: maggiesmomColumbus
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in July of 2008. We stayed one night. I was trying to save a little money before going directly into downtown Chicago the next night. This place was pathetic. Not friendly at all and I felt sort of creeped out, ha, as did the rest in our party. We had two rooms. Part of the curtain was hanging down in my room, cigarette burns on the sinks, cracks in the ceiling. The air conditioner was broke in the second room and they did move them to another room. It was rather dingy and seemed like 1980's decor. I have been a little spoiled as we usually stay at a Hilton, but this place was nasty. I would never go back again and wish I had spent the extra money for a little nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town but.........”
Reviews.Author: Lemson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 2 nights in June 08. We found the hotel nice, clean and with the convenience of free Wifi and a restaurant. The room was clean and a good size although a bit dated. We visited Chicago to do some sight seeing and unfortunately the hotel is quite a way out from Downtown so if you're looking to stay close to the attractions/shops/restaurants etc. then I wouldn't advise staying here. About a ten minute walk away is a few places to eat, laundry and shops which we found useful. The restaurant next door which is part of the hotel was very nice. We sat down to eat late and so didn't expect a lot but we were pleasantly surprised at both the quality of food and service. Overall a nice stay but not a great location.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel72
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for a couple of days while a family member was at U of C hospital. This hotel is one that offers a discount to U of C patients. We were hesitant to stay here because of the reviews but because the locations was so ideal, we took the chance. We are so glad we took the chance. The room was clean including the bedding, bathroom and carpet. The staff were all friendly. We felt the neighborhood was fine. We never felt afraid. The only things we didn't care for were the elevator (inspected?) and the smell of the hallway. The room did not smell bad. There is a taxi stop directly outside the hotel but if you choose to drive yourself, the front desk is more than happy to give you a map with specific instructions on the best way to get somewhere. In fact, the front desk was alway more than happy to help answer our questions, and we had several. I took my laptop and had no problem receiving a wireless signal in our room on the 3rd floor. The restaurant/lounge was a nice place to sit back and relax. We will be staying here again soon. I recommend giving it a try if you aren't too picky of a person. If you want a 4-5 star room, I suggest driving downtown and paying for the 4-5 star room. This hotel is not a diamond at a cubic zirconia price, it is just a plan jane 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mel23Pinconning_MI
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the Ramada Lake Shore made the stay very enjoyable. Angie at the front desk was very helpful with directions on how to get to different locations thorughout Chicago. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: joachim16
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Lake Shore is a great compromise between staying in town and getting a reasonable room rate. There has been some remodeling work going on during our stay, but this didn't make the stay uncomfortable. The personal has been friendly. The Restaurant in the conference building belonging to the hotel is great. Friday nights buffet w/ Jazz is highly recommended, a lot of fun and great dinner for around 20$!. CTA bus no. 6 is an easy way to get to the museums and into town within just a few minutes. We will certainly stay at the Ramada again!

Reviews.Title: “nice view”
Reviews.Author: celty12
Reviews.Content: The good things about our stay were we found the staff to be pleasant,the bathroom was clean,bed was comfortable with clean sheets,and had a great view of the lake.The bad things were the tv had a terrible picture that couldn't be adjusted,the bed pillows were too thin,the fridge didn't work and the coffeemaker made coffee so weak it looked like weak tea(and only managed to spew out 2 very small portions). I must say we ate at the restaurant there and had a wonderfully delicious meal.Also must add I would stay there again because a clean bathroom and a comfortable clean bed are the most important things to me in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: madwiscubfan
Reviews.Content: Had a work engagement in Chicago for a couple of days during two different weeks. I'm don't generally chose 5 star elegance and service at high prices. Working on the Soutside of Chicago and wanted a reasonably priced place with high speed internet and free parking. Mapped the work location on Google and searched nearby hotels and found this Ramada. Restaurant, room service a plus. Covered parking in Chicago, in winter is a great perk. Self-serv parking elsewhere in Chicago is $29+ per night. The first stay in the last week of February, I had a room about 399 yards from Lake Michigan and with a view of the south side of Downtown Chicago. Nice, comfortable, clean with a coffee maker, fridge and comfortable bed. Ordered room service one night and had a good 10 oz. Ribeye for $20. Only bad part of the stay was the internet not working. After confirming that the internet was working, I booked two days the next week. Internet was working, as I am writing this from the room. When I checked in, Angie, the frint desk staff welcomed me back. The room I was first assigned was not adequate. The TV remote did not work even after replaing the batteries and the fridge was not working. Called the front desk and Angie immediately reassigned me a large room with a working remote, fridge and a microwave. The room was not a suite, but was huge. The view was not on the lake, but in a big city, the view of the tall building is always spectacular. My sone lives in Chicago and when visiting him, we have payed much more for less than here oven on Priceline. I will book a room at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost a customer”
Reviews.Author: rosco70
Reviews.Content: Before we booked our room online. We made sure to check and see if the rooms had wi-fi. The website for Ramada Lake Shore Said that in fact indeed their was in room Wi-fi. We also checked about a refidgerator and was told their was one in room as well. When we arrived not only was the lobby and hotel torn up for renavition,which their should have been notice of posted on the website. But their was no in room wi-fi and only a small cooler built into a broken piece of furniture instead of a refridgerator. The furniture in the room was broken down scratced up and in poor condition. This is not acceptable for 140.00 a night. We were going to stay for three nights but instead spent one night because we arrived late in the evening. We stay in hotels 4 to 5 times a year. This was our first time and our last time at ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Starshyne09
Reviews.Content: When we were planning a vacation through Chicago, I chose the Ramada, because I have always had nice experiences at Ramada and this one had a free shuttle that would take us around the city. When we arrived, we learned that the shuttle was broken. No one at the front desk was able to give us any assisstance on exactly how we were going to get around, and since we had never been to Chicago, we did not know directions. We had to go to a gas station and buy a map. Our room was dirty and the shower did not drain. The cleaning staff apparently stole the pillows we brought from home, and the front desk staff again would not assist us. The only good I found at the Ramada was the location close to Lake Michigan (you can walk right across to it) and the resturant food was very good. But no matter what....do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pefectly fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: bosco111
Reviews.Content: Hey people, when you book a hotel that costs half what the Hilton charges, you're not going to get the Hilton! It was perfectly fine for the price and location -- room was clean, everything worked (even the TV remote), hot water was steady. The major problem was that the only working ice machine was on the 4th floor. Whoop-de-doo. Will stay there again, in fact I already booked it for next month.

Reviews.Title: “a towel with boo boo in the hallway next to room 322 laying on the floor”
Reviews.Author: asthmatic
Reviews.Content: my 8 year old son has very bad asthma,the doctor at uic of chicago was testing some new medicne for his asthma so they wanted us to stay close by, so i rent a room at ramada hotel on lake shore drive , the 1st room he was coughing bad so i asked if could give me another room, all the room she showed my was , worst then the 1st including the one with the towel with boo boo, so we decided keep the frist one, i had to buy a puirfer and prayed for the days to pass, in the end i meet two very nice lady who worked in the dinning area, whom made us feel very special ,but the rooms need help! i you have any family member who have lung problem the ramada inn is not a good place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Gyped at the Ramada Inn, Lakeshore drive, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travel4bizness
Reviews.Content: Let's start off with 2 good points about the hotel. It has working internet access like it says it does. Secondly, there if you are lucky, you may get a room with a great view of Lake Michigan across the highway from you. I guess a 3rd plus is that we saw no roaches. Now for the real. This spot is run down and when I say run down I do mean run down to the point of neglect. I don't know when last the vents were cleaned, but they were so dusty that it looked like grey cauliflower coming through the grate. The hall carpet is filthy. It is akin to walking through a back alley behind a butchers shop. Who konws what ran off into it, but it is sticky. The property has a laundry list of things that need to be fixed that is too long to detail: on 4 floors only 2 ice machines only 1 of which was working, broken windows in rooms fixed with a bit of clear tape, air conditioners that do not work, holes slammed in sheetrock everywhere..... The list continues for many more paragraphs. Parking too, is a bit of a joke. Though not as bad as some places, having to fight with locals who parked across the entrance to the hotel to watch July 4th fireworks and parked in the Guests only parking then came in to tell the manager they were gonna 'block him in for a minute' while my wife & I cruised the roads around trying to get into the hotel lot........ Oh, cable tv didn't work and at first, neither did the phone. They tried to get me to fix it over the phone ( I called on my cell phone) and I had to tell them to just send the phone guy unless they were going to pay me...... Best of luck staying there. Forewarned is forearmed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bargain in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Southernmainer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the price was so low - $99.00 per night. I didn't read any reviews until shortly before we left and I then got very nervous because most of them were pretty negative. But, the hotels in the center of Chicago where all the tourist attractions are were simply unaffordable for us, so we proceeded to stay at the Ramada. I'm happy to say I was pleasantly surprised by our experience. All in all, for the price, this choice was fine. We knew upfront that there was no free shuttle service between the airports and the hotel. It costs about $50.00 to get from the airport to the city unless you use the train or bus. We chose to use a cab for our return to O'Hare and the Omega Shuttle upon our arrival. (Omega goes between the airports and the south side.) The accomodations themselves: The bed was comfortable; the bathroom was newly renovated and the shower was the best I've ever used anywhere. The room appeared to be as clean as any hotel I have stayed in and we were resupplied with fresh towels every day. The TV included HBO and Showtime, although the reception for Showtime never did work. As well, most of the cable stations were full of "snow" and difficult to watch. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It was unseasonably warm in Chicago and it took a day to get the air conditioning on again, but they did respond to our request. The hotel itself is a bit rundown, but if you're really there to see the city, it's fine. There is a taxi stand right there, so you can always get a cab. And the bus stop is about two blocks away. The neighborhood felt safe to me. We took the bus most days using a three day visitor pass that cost $12.00 per person, unlimited use. Ramada does have a free shuttle that will take you downtown and pick you up daily if you want to visit the attractions there. We didn't use it because we're early birds and wanted to get going very early every day. The biggest surprise to me was how good their restaurant was. The only complaint I had was that the vegetables were the same almost every night and were not seasoned properly. But everything else was delicious. Their breakfast buffet was superb and the wait staff was very polite and helpful. All in all, this hotel is a terrific bargain for Chicago. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CFLin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ramada Lake Shore for 1 week. The room was generally clean and well-maintained. Room service was good. Reception was also nice. They might not act as eager as you expected for 5-star hotels, but that's not what you can expect from this hotel. The hotels in Chicago are really expensive. For this kind of price, Ramada is considered a good choice. The connection to downtown depends on Taxi or Metra Electric Railway. Taxi to McCormick Place is about 10 min and costs approximately 11USD. Metra Electric runs more frequently around 7 o'clock. The 53th Street and the 47th street stations are equally far from Ramada. It's takes about 10min to walk there. I'd suggest the 53th street since the way to it seems easier. Some trains do not stop at the 47th street station. Internet connection is a real problem. It is unstable and seems relatively slow. Those live in the 2-floor building might not be able to use it. Sometimes connection can be established at around the window at certain angle. If you have an external antenna, it might be easier. That's why sometimes you can see people taking their notebook to lobby. Suggestions to the hotel: improve the internet connection and place a brochure in room about the amenities and house rules.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: CaliGal57
Reviews.Content: Expected more from the description. Hotel needs to be updated. Telephone did not work and staff seemed uninterested in alleviating the problem. Shuttle runs on a tight schedule, unlike what is described in the Hotel directory. Hallways smelled of decaying carpets. Could hear the neighbors conversation at 4:00 a.m. through the vent in the bathroom. But, the rooms were kept very clean and there is a great view of Lake Michigan.
